segment.source: Use this method in the Windows Store collection API to get all the products that a customer owns for apps that are associated with your Azure AD client ID.
segment.target: Use this method in the Windows Store collection API to get all the products that a customer owns for apps that are associated with your Azure AD client ID.

segment.source: You can scope your query to a particular product, or use other filters.
segment.target: You can scope your query to a particular product, or use other filters.

segment.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive

segment.source: Use this method in the Windows Store collection API to get all the products that a customer owns for apps that are associated with your Azure AD client ID.
segment.target: Use this method in the Windows Store collection API to get all the products that a customer owns for apps that are associated with your Azure AD client ID.

segment.source: You can scope your query to a particular product, or use other filters.
segment.target: You can scope your query to a particular product, or use other filters.

segment.source: This method is designed to be called by your service in response to a message from your app.
segment.target: This method is designed to be called by your service in response to a message from your app.

segment.source: Your service should not regularly poll for all users on a schedule.
segment.target: Your service should not regularly poll for all users on a schedule.

segment.source: To use this method, you will need:
segment.target: To use this method, you will need:

segment.source: An Azure AD access token that was created with the audience URI.
segment.target: An Azure AD access token that was created with the audience URI.

segment.source: A Windows Store ID key that was generated by calling the GetCustomerCollectionsIdAsync method from client-side code in your app.
segment.target: A Windows Store ID key that was generated by calling the GetCustomerCollectionsIdAsync method from client-side code in your app.

segment.source: For more information, see View and grant products from a service.
segment.target: For more information, see View and grant products from a service.

segment.source: The Azure AD access token in the form Bearertoken.
segment.target: The Azure AD access token in the form Bearertoken.

segment.source: Must be set to the value collections.mp.microsoft.com.
segment.target: Must be set to the value collections.mp.microsoft.com.

segment.source: The length of the request body.
segment.target: The length of the request body.

segment.source: Specifies the request and response type.
segment.target: Specifies the request and response type.

segment.source: Currently, the only supported value is application/json.
segment.target: Currently, the only supported value is application/json.

segment.source: A UserIdentity object that represents the user being queried for products.
segment.target: A UserIdentity object that represents the user being queried for products.

segment.source: If there are multiple sets of products, the response body returns a continuation token when the page limit is reached.
segment.target: If there are multiple sets of products, the response body returns a continuation token when the page limit is reached.

segment.source: Provide that continuation token here in subsequent calls to retrieve remaining products.
segment.target: Provide that continuation token here in subsequent calls to retrieve remaining products.

segment.source: The maximum number of products to return in one response.
segment.target: The maximum number of products to return in one response.

segment.source: The default and maximum value is 100.
segment.target: The default and maximum value is 100.

segment.source: If specified, the service only returns products that have been modified after this date.
segment.target: If specified, the service only returns products that have been modified after this date.

segment.source: If specified, the service only returns IAPs that correspond to the specified app.
segment.target: If specified, the service only returns IAPs that correspond to the specified app.

segment.source: If specified, the service only returns products applicable to the provided Product/SKU pairs.
segment.target: If specified, the service only returns products applicable to the provided Product/SKU pairs.

segment.source: If specified, the service only returns products that match the specified product types.
segment.target: If specified, the service only returns products that match the specified product types.

segment.source: Supported product types are Application, Durable, and UnmanagedConsumable.
segment.target: Supported product types are Application, Durable, and UnmanagedConsumable.

segment.source: When set to All, all products for a user will be returned, including expired items.
segment.target: When set to All, all products for a user will be returned, including expired items.

segment.source: When set to Valid, only products that are valid at this point in time are returned (that is, they have an active status, start date now, and end date is now).
segment.target: When set to Valid, only products that are valid at this point in time are returned (that is, they have an active status, start date now, and end date is now).

segment.source: The UserIdentity object contains the following parameters.
segment.target: The UserIdentity object contains the following parameters.

segment.source: String value of the Windows Store ID key.
segment.target: String value of the Windows Store ID key.

segment.source: Requested identifier for the returned products.
segment.target: Requested identifier for the returned products.

segment.source: Returned items in the response body will have a matching localTicketReference.
segment.target: Returned items in the response body will have a matching localTicketReference.

segment.source: We recommend that you use the same value as the userId claim in the Windows Store ID key.
segment.target: We recommend that you use the same value as the userId claim in the Windows Store ID key.

segment.source: The ProductSkuId object contains the following parameters.
segment.target: The ProductSkuId object contains the following parameters.

segment.source: The Store ID from the Windows Store catalog.
segment.target: The Store ID from the Windows Store catalog.

segment.source: The Store ID is available on the App identity page of the Dev Center dashboard.
segment.target: The Store ID is available on the App identity page of the Dev Center dashboard.

segment.source: The SKU ID from the Windows Store catalog.
segment.target: The SKU ID from the Windows Store catalog.

segment.source: If there are multiple sets of products, this token is returned when the page limit is reached.
segment.target: If there are multiple sets of products, this token is returned when the page limit is reached.

segment.source: You can specify this continuation token in subsequent calls to retrieve remaining products.
segment.target: You can specify this continuation token in subsequent calls to retrieve remaining products.

segment.source: An array of products for the specified user.
segment.target: An array of products for the specified user.

segment.source: The CollectionItemContractV6 object contains the following parameters.
segment.target: The CollectionItemContractV6 object contains the following parameters.

segment.source: The date on which the user acquired the item.
segment.target: The date on which the user acquired the item.

segment.source: The campaign ID that was provided at purchase time for this item.
segment.target: The campaign ID that was provided at purchase time for this item.

segment.source: The offer ID from an in-app purchase.
segment.target: The offer ID from an in-app purchase.

segment.source: The end date of the item.
segment.target: The end date of the item.

segment.source: The developer-specified product ID string that is assigned to the item in the Windows Dev Center dashboard.
segment.target: The developer-specified product ID string that is assigned to the item in the Windows Dev Center dashboard.

segment.source: An ID that identifies this collection item from other items the user owns.
segment.target: An ID that identifies this collection item from other items the user owns.

segment.source: This ID is unique per product.
segment.target: This ID is unique per product.

segment.source: The ID of the previously supplied in the request body.
segment.target: The ID of the previously supplied in the request body.

segment.source: The date this item was last modified.
segment.target: The date this item was last modified.

segment.source: If present, the order ID of which this item was obtained.
segment.target: If present, the order ID of which this item was obtained.

segment.source: If present, the line item of the particular order for which this item was obtained.
segment.target: If present, the line item of the particular order for which this item was obtained.

segment.source: The Store ID for the app from the Windows Store catalog.
segment.target: The Store ID for the app from the Windows Store catalog.

segment.source: One of the following product types: Application, Durable, and UnmanagedConsumable.
segment.target: One of the following product types: Application, Durable, and UnmanagedConsumable.

segment.source: If present, this represents the identity of the purchaser of the item.
segment.target: If present, this represents the identity of the purchaser of the item.

segment.source: See the details for this object below.
segment.target: See the details for this object below.

segment.source: The SKU ID from the Windows Store catalog.
segment.target: The SKU ID from the Windows Store catalog.

segment.source: Possible values include Trial, Full, and Rental.
segment.target: Possible values include Trial, Full, and Rental.

segment.source: The date that the item starts being valid.
segment.target: The date that the item starts being valid.

segment.source: Possible values include Active, Expired, Revoked, and Banned.
segment.target: Possible values include Active, Expired, Revoked, and Banned.

segment.source: The transaction ID as a result of the purchase of this item.
segment.target: The transaction ID as a result of the purchase of this item.

segment.source: Can be used for reporting an item as fulfilled.
segment.target: Can be used for reporting an item as fulfilled.

segment.source: The IdentityContractV6 object contains the following parameters.
segment.target: The IdentityContractV6 object contains the following parameters.

segment.source: The string value of the publisherUserId from the specified Windows Store ID key.
segment.target: The string value of the publisherUserId from the specified Windows Store ID key.

segment.source: View and grant products from a service
segment.target: View and grant products from a service

segment.source: Renew a Windows Store ID key
segment.target: Renew a Windows Store ID key
